description: 7.7x58mm 'Arisaka' ammunition with 202 gr copper head, lead core bullets.  Designated by the Imperial Japanese Army to replace the standard 6.5x50mmR ammo during WWII, yet it wasn't able to fully replace the previous cartridge by the end of the war.

7.7x58mm 'Arisaka' ammunition with 136 gr brass head, steel core bullets.  Designated by the Imperial Japanese Army to replace the standard 6.5x50mmR ammo during WWII, yet it wasn't able to fully replace the previous cartridge by the end of the war.

7.7x58mm 'Arisaka' case, with a 138 gr steel core FMJ bullet replacing the ancient lead core version.  This slightly increases the penetration while reducing the weight, at the cost of slightly reduced damage due shortcommings during the craftmanship.
//: This should not exist in reality. It's just a 77x58a but has the brass-steel bullet replaced for copper-steel custom, because I assume that when you reload these like that if given the chance
